metadata.title: CVE-2021-40346 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
An integer overflow exists in HAProxy 2.0 through 2.5 in htx_add_headerthat can be exploited to perform an HTTP request smuggling attack, allowingan attacker to bypass all configured http-request HAProxy ACLs and possiblyother ACLs.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-40346` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

haproxy - 2.0.13-2ubuntu0.3
vim-haproxy - 2.0.13-2ubuntu0.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: haproxy package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.0.13-2ubuntu0.3').
